DataElement.preferredName: Patient National Surgical Adjuvant Breast Project Letrozole Registration Identifier Number
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the Cooperative Group-specific identification number assigned by the National Surgical Adjuvant Breast and Bowel Project to a patient on the Letrozole Registration Program.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient National Surgical Adjuvant Breast Project Letrozole Registration Identifier
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the patient's NSABP ID on the Letrozole Registration Program (letrozole; an anticancer drug that belongs to the family of drugs called nonsteroidal aromatase inhibitors).

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredDefinition: A nonsteroidal inhibitor of estrogen synthesis that resembles paclitaxel in chemical structure.  As a third-generation aromatase inhibitor, letrozole selectively and reversibly inhibits aromatase, a cytochrome P-450 enzyme complex found in many tissues including those of the premenopausal ovary, liver, and breast; aromatase catalyzes the aromatization of androstenedione and testosterone into estrone and estradiol, the final step in estrogen biosynthesis.  In estrogen-dependent breast cancers, ananstrozole may inhibit tumor growth. (NCI04):One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

Concepts.definition: A nonsteroidal inhibitor of estrogen synthesis with antineoplastic activity. As a third-generation aromatase inhibitor, letrozole selectively and reversibly inhibits aromatase, which may result in growth inhibition of estrogen-dependent breast cancer cells. Aromatase, a cytochrome P-450 enzyme localized to the endoplasmic reticulum of the cell and found in many tissues including those of the premenopausal ovary, liver, and breast, catalyzes the aromatization of androstenedione and testosterone into estrone and estradiol, the final step in estrogen biosynthesis.
One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: unique identifier assigned to the patient by a Cooperative Group for a protocol.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification.

Concepts.definition: A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.

DataElement.origin: NSABP CRF:National Surgical Adjuvant Breast and Bowel Project Case Report Form
